titleStmt.title: O. M. Randall et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency the Govnor of the commonwealth of Kentucky

Wharas there was 2 Judgment against Elizah. D. Kirk one for Eight dollars reached the 6th day of February 1864 and one for $25-. Cowth Judgts was reached before J M Randall a Justice of the peace for Shelby County and the Said Elizah D Kirk is a very poor man & a good citizen and we the undersigned would Respectfully ask that your Excellency would Remit Said fines beliving his case is one that you should interpose the Executive clemency

O M Randall J. P. S. C
Henry Pemberton
Able Jenkins
H C. Utterback
J C. McChesney
James Darlington
Granvill Allen
Richd Kirk
Jacob Riddle
H. S. Mayhall
P. D. Johnson
W. J. Baugh
Names
Benj Utterback
B. F. White
James.T. Hyatt
P M Utterback
Philip.D. Arnold
John Slucer Sen
J. C. Taylor
Henry Spolding
C. F. Johnson
H. G. McBrayer

Shelby Co
Commonwealth
vs } Petition
E. D. Kirk
Refused
Thos E Bramlette
